Header: Security in Ports to be beefed up
Content: Measures have been taken to beef up security in Ports in line with the anti-drug campaign being implemented island wide. Minister Sagala Ratnayake has instructed the Sri Lanka Ports Authority to take necessary steps to tighten security in the Ports. Accordingly, the Ports Authority is working hand in hand with the Sri Lanka Police to ensure security at the Colombo Port. A new security plan will be implemented. Meanwhile, Sagala Ratnayake has also informed the management of the Sri Lanka Ports Authority to carry out all transactions of the Authority in accordance with the due tender and procurement procedures. He also stressed that the activities of the Authority need to be done in hundred percent transparency.
